title: Arsenal fan John Lydon slams Arsene Wenger's "empire of insane mediocrity" and says it's time for the boss to go
text:
Arsenal fan John Lydon slams Arsene Wenger's "empire of insane mediocrity" and says it's time for the boss to go The punk legend hits out at Wenger, claiming he's presided over an "empire of insane mediocrity" Share Punk legend Lydon sang God Save The Queen but doesn't want to save Arsene Wenger (Photo: Getty Images North America)   
Punk legend John Lydon claims there should be anarchy at the Emirates to force Arsene Wenger out of Arsenal. 
Lifelong Arsenal fan Lydon - famously known as Johnny Rotten - says Wenger has turned Arsenal into an “empire of insane mediocrity.” 
Lydon, in an interview with talkSPORT, said: “I'm afraid Mr Wenger has got to go. He's the only man in the world of soccer who is not capable of recognising his own mistakes and makes those mistakes year in and year out. 
"He's never tidied the up defence, the midfield is a fiasco and the ping pong nonsense that means no-one will ever get the chance to score. 
"When he took over, we had the best defence in the world, how has he managed to dismantle that? He's dismantled everything. How has he not replaced Tony Adams, one of the world's best captains? Patrick Vieira? 
"It's all about this new stadium, this empire of insane mediocrity. It's like a tennis culture. It's not the fans' fault. There's just not enough going on on the pitch to get yourself revved up about. Wenger is coming under increased pressure from fans despite the likelihood of a new two-year contract (Photo: PA) 
"Alexis Sanchez - there's no point in him hanging about. It also explains why the potential in the young players never came about. It's just so easy for them.” 
Lydon also claims it is time for Arsenal fans to stay away and claims he would rather see them go down than Wenger get a new two year contract. 
He added: ”The current mob filling the stadium, instead of us real Arsenal supporters, will stay outside. It can't go on like that. The Wenger Out chorus is getting louder (Photo: AFP) 
"The new club is awful in its attitude. It really did its best to eliminate us out. They have priced us out. 
"I get up at 4am every Saturday morning in LA to watch, knowing that an hour and a half later I will be disappointed. It's a game. But you'd like to win it occasionally. 
"Wenger is clinging on for dear life but the hurricane will eventually blow him off the tree. The prospects look grim. When he does there won't be anybody left available. He;'s slowly but surely unravelling this club. 
"As me and my mates all agree, we'd rather Arsenal drop back a league and slowly come back again rather than put up with fourth, fourth, fourth. Fourth is the first. From that day on, I lost respect for him.” 
The full interview will be played on talkSPORT’s Breakfast show from 6am to 10am on Wednesday. Like us on Facebook
